intro: Lindernia robyniae, commonly known as the Robynia lindernia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple, typically blooming in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardens. Due to its adaptability and aesthetic appeal, it is often cultivated in tropical and subtropical regions.
